measure.name: residential_simulation_controls
measure.description: Set the simulation timesteps per hour, the run period begin month/day and end month/day, and the calendar year (for start day of week).
measure.modeler_description: Set the simulation timesteps per hour on the Timestep object, the run period begin month/day and end month/day on the RunPeriod object, and the calendar year on the YearDescription object.

argument.name: timesteps_per_hr
argument.description: The value entered here is the number of (zone) timesteps to use within an hour. For example a value of 6 entered here directs the program to use a zone timestep of 10 minutes and a value of 60 means a 1 minute timestep.

argument.name: begin_month
argument.description: This numeric field should contain the starting month number (1 = January, 2 = February, etc.) for the annual run period desired.

argument.name: begin_day_of_month
argument.display_name: Run Period Begin Day of Month
argument.description: This numeric field should contain the starting day of the starting month (must be valid for month) for the annual run period desired.

argument.name: end_month
argument.description: This numeric field should contain the ending month number (1 = January, 2 = February, etc.) for the annual run period desired.

argument.name: end_day_of_month
argument.display_name: Run Period End Day of Month
argument.description: This numeric field should contain the ending day of the ending month (must be valid for month) for the annual run period desired.
